name: revdj
text: I love the way that, subtly, Philippe's expression brightens in each panel.

name: ghostd
text: As does Emeril's.

name: orvel
text: As does mine.

name: foetus_punch
text: Actually, his face stays exactly the same for three panels, and then "surprised eyebrows" appear. Phillipe is ridiculously happy about that impossible car feat! As is Emeril!

name: fuckyoufriday
text: I didn't know who Emeril was at the time this strip first "aired". I still liked it a lot, though. I wonder if there's a whole dimension of achewood I'm missing out on because I don't watch the Food Network...

name: pinballchacha
text: Me neither...actually, is there anyone out there who fancies explaining this Emeril fellow to us Britishers? He looks like fun.

name: ford
text: He is basically a man with a cooking show and an unusually flamboyant personality.  His catch phrases include "Let's kick this up a notch!" When he is about to add spice to food and "Bam!" as he adds the spice

name: ford
text: Also he has successfully branded lines of spices and cooking gear, and i know all of this without ever having seen a complete episode of his show (I put my total Emeril-watching experience at about .7 hours spaced over several random occasions)

name: tekende
text: I used to work at Foley's (all the Foley's in my area are Macy's now though) and sometimes I would be in the cookware department. We had a whole bunch of Emeril stuff. Pans, knives, spices, you name it. I spent many boring hours staring at the products in their bright red boxes with Emeril's smiling face on them.

name: farqussus
text: so he's a fuckhead.

name: spinynorman
text:
Emeril basically created The Food Network and ushered in a new era of "Celebrity Chefs" after Julia Childs.

I understand he's actually an okay dude, according to Anthony Bourdain, who used to spend most of his career drinking beer from the sideline and catcalling.

name: landowmpg
text: From the snout of a spice weasel?

name: ssddr
text: the fact that Emeril's car can pop a wheelie is much more impressive when you know that his car includes a full service kitchen for entertaining.

name: rowboat
text: And an enormous cauliflower ass.

name: foetus_punch
text: The kitchen is mounted on gyroscopes? The cauliflower ass is mounted on large hips?

name: caseyb3
text:
It's a fucking limo and it can pop a fucking wheelie.

I'd spout eyebrows too. Jesus Christ.

name: parsifal
text: hahaha

name: thisdoggisproice
text: I bet the car's ability to pop a wheelie is just the first of many amazing abilities, that was probably a good starting point.  Why is Emeril sinking?

name: never_die
text: so the viewer can focus more on his eyebrows.

name: deancain29
text: Philippe. I love his tie - he's made such an effort.

name: nathanielperson
text: All limos should be required by law to be able to pop mad wheelies.

name: especial
text: My love for your avatar cannot be properly conveyed.

name: spectre
text: Alt text: "Maybe on Monday."

name: pitseleh
text: The fact that Emeril is Philippe's celebrity idol just tickles me to death.

name: crinklebat
text: I can attest that little kids freaking LOVE Emeril.

name: quarantine
text: I love Philippe's imaginings of how things will go.

name: heyman
text: kind of like the build up and crushing letdown of the Teodor's Mickey Mouse pancake

name: foetus_punch
text: Why did you remind me of that emotional brutality, humping stormtrooper! Why!

name: lamewad
text: I love seeing Philippe's thoughts! It makes my day.

name: luckypyjamas
text: the last panel makes me feel like emeril is drowning or something.

name: orvel
text: I 5'ed this for Philippe's eyebrows in the last panel.

name: tekende
text: I like how Philippe looks surprised by the revelation in the last panel even though he thought of it.

name: kelsotimebomb
text: Emeril's eyebrow in panel 3 just makes it for me.

name: mrchee
text: Achewood

name: fattypneumonia
text:
[IMGS OFF]

"Jerk chicken, jerk beef, jerk pork. Is there any meat this man can't jerk?"
